ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: I feel I know enough about causes of drinking problems to carry out my role when working with patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel I can appropriately advise my patients about drinking and its effects
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel I do not have much to be proud of when working with patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: All in all I am inclined to feel I am a failure with patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I want to work with patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Pessimism is the most realistic attitude to take towards patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel I have the right to ask patients with unhealthy alcohol use questions about their drinking when necessary
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel that my patients believe I have the right to ask them questions about drinking when necessary
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In general, it is rewarding to work with patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In general I like patients with unhealthy alcohol use
Notes: 1=Strong disagree; 2=Somewhat strongly disagree; 3=Disagree; 4=Neither disagree nor agree; 5=Agree; 6=Somewhat strongly agree; 7=Strongly agree
